review_title: a big new experience in the field of Project negotiation and sourcing, all over mindanao as my assignment for now.
pros: to break the the blocking hesitations and fear in exposure to various places with different cultures and belief....company structure must be carefully and strategically studied based on the data and field verifications
cons: starting the business branch-out /expansion needs delicate decisions in considering matters relative to the operation...delayed response on the needs in field operation, can cause poor marketing output.

review_title: Great visions but poor corporate culture
pros: Great place to learn your likes and dislikes in a company culture and the co-workers make the job tolerable. Most are aware of the situation and are compassionate towards their fellow colleague. Some flexibility in job movement within the organisation.
cons: Organization, management commitment and communication was terrible and frustrating. Clique-ish working environment (almost like high school all over again). If you are a performer, more responsibilities are piled on you but without any pay increase and you are expected to be thankful for the extra work.

review_title: Learn a lot about the Indonesian capital market
pros: Understood the  mechanism of the Indonesian capital market, the pattern of stock movement, the psychology of traders big and small, how the money flows from client to brokers/traders and back.  Abundant opportunity to trade on your own
cons: If you are not creative and look out for yourself it is a dead end position, unlikely to get anywhere, very boring and monotonous.  The learning opportunities are those beside of your job function, not directly related to it.

review_title: good to stay if you seek mediocrity
pros:
Good commission for sales personnel
Family oriented bank
Good training platform for starters
Best local bank to work in
Almost one month annual leave
Good medical benefits
cons:
Too short sighted
Area managers lose touch with branch staffs
too much theatrics 
Slightly backdated IT software and machines
Sales personnel treated badly by certain group sales manager
Not about how hard you work and how good your performance is. More of whether your bosses likes you or not

review_title: Highest commmisions but highest targets. Common to find products being pushed by management.
pros:
moderate tolerance to non-performance
strong personal coaching and training
senior management takes time and effort to know you
cons:
lack of willingness from sales support
products are not competitive
sales management is highly political, follow the right boss or die.
extremely limited products you can advise as compared to similar roles in other banks

review_title: Great for having your own life
pros: Plenty of time to do your own research and learn. Very forgiving workplace. Great if corporate climbing isn't your thing
cons:
You can check in anytime you like, but you can never leave. 
Only for the family oriented, uninitiated and those who can't stand staying in the office past 6pm

pros: Flexibility in working hours, for off days, study leave and a fair remuneration system for performance based, very sound financial status in Singapore.
cons: Not as competitive as major offshore banks, benefits ,perks and remuneration for staffs are not as attractive as offshore banks.

pros: very good culture and very nice employees in china, the business is ok. still need several space to improve.....
cons: limited promotion, too many singaproean in the bank, every promotion has been provided to them, i think this should be vhanged

review_title: Temp staff in the remittance department processing telegraphic transfers
pros: Work was simple and do not require much thinking. Has a simple pantry for free drinks. Pay was slightly above average for temp staff. Nice office culture
cons: Work is really boring as it is mostly data entry. Feels like being a robot churning out numbers. Might need to work overtime sometimes, especially nearing the end of the month when there is high volume.

review_title: I worked at UOB Global Banknotes  I T
pros: Good Staff benefits ,  Well reputable bank
cons: Management and Manager surfing Internet by bank pc during work hours cheating travel allowance cheating on-site visit record

pros: Bank that goes after rational and sustainable growth.
cons: Annual salary increment is slow and bonuses are nothing to shout about.

pros: Local bank. United Overseas Bank has a loyal, wide and established customers which provide a constant stream of potential revenue
cons: If you are under a black-listed manager, you can forget about career advancement. United Overseas Bank is a very traditional bank, hence they are still entrenched in their ways, forward looking employees have to adapt.

pros: it is a growing organisation and gives ample support to employees to perform to the fullest
cons: Since its a growing organisation the operations are not completely set up and also lot of work is manual due to which quite a lot of time gets utilised on manual preparation of reports

pros: Supportive colleagues, the mentor was very willing to share his experience and knowledge. Was given various kinds of jobs to do, allowed me to learn and understand the operations within the department.
cons: The HR staff were not kind. They sort of stereotyped the interns are immature and they always give out orders and would not allow the interns to express their ideas.

pros: Professional and well-equipped office enviornment, Well-trained employees, Reasonable compensation and other offers. Company has global network to share market comments.
cons: Might need to work overtime sometimes. Detailed work division might cause always focusing own duties and lack of bigger picture.

pros: Stable job. Close knitted environment.
cons:
China-man bank. Thinking a bit old fashion. For eg, off from work early means not doing your job or being lazy.
A lot of ad-hoc assignments that are not within the audit plan. High turnover. Pay does not commensurate with the contribution to the department.

pros: - The company looks strong financially that make your job very secure
cons:
- The  operating system is quite old in banking business
- No flexibility in term of initiatives - everything must be approved by HQ in Singapore

pros: Nice compensation, and work life balance office life
cons: Lack of people development, be more diligent to your talent inside rather than outside

review_title: A good place as a start because of their teaching culture
pros: very safe environment, so it's almost alright to make mistakes, small ones of course, and you get to learn from them.
cons: being such a safe environment, the opportunity to make a mistake is so small that you won't gain much from personal experience

pros:

pros: good prospects, result oriented, good bosses, my boss was good. good culture. positive environment.. good colleagues. happy place to work.

pros: Excellent working culture, good values, encourage learning, supportive and career progression.

review_title: Long working hours but good bonus
pros: Good on target bonus makes the long hours slightly bearable.
cons: Political place to work in. Not about what you know but who you know. Very long working hours.

pros: Great salary, great culture, great people!
cons: I have absolutely no cons with this business at all. Everything that they had promised me initially has come to fruition and I am very happy with my decision.

pros: Well plan and proper executions of product launches. It is a company where supervisors are concern about the well-being of staffs.
cons: There is no policy allowing staff transfer from a country to another.
